title: Why can't people admit they're playing some kind of noob champs.
body:
let's start setting up my noob champ list (i hope u agree with it):
-Lux
-Fizz
-Akali
-Talon
-Yasuo
-Garen
-Darius
-Mf
and some others... 
I played all of these champs, i tried them. I kindred main and i think not u can say kindred is a noob champ compared to how muh time u saw kindred players. People say there are like "combos" or "techniques" for these champs. I was like "ok" so i wanted to see a yasuo tuto.
Then i saw that on of the combos was litteraly "Flash+ Auto Attack" -__- seriously... thx for the tip man. Then i realized all the combos shawed were actually normal different bursts. And it's the same for all the cahmps in the list. u spam ur spells (with balanced damage ofc) and u win.
The builds also. Akali can have OP lifesteal with only 1 item.
Well im tired of these guys saying they play difficult champs, spamming masterie 7 and teabagging when i played all of them and i can tell they're nooby AF.
Comment if u think so and if ur a lux main, well go away xD

replies.body:
Let me hit you with one of those hard to swallow pills:

****All champions in League takes skill to a certain extent.****

There are no "noob" champions. Just some that are more mechanically intense than others.
I'm glad people like you exist even after this game has been out for almost a decade.
You just want to feel superior... that's mean.{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-popcorn}}

I don't think {{champion:99}} and {{champion:21}} are noob champions. They are too squishy and lack mobility. They require good positioning. Not to mention all of {{champion:99}}'s abilities are skillshots.

Lux's skill shots can easily be eliminated the moment she lands a root on you. Unless you're really bad, there's no way you're missing a skill shot on an immobile target. Root and ult, my friend. Root and ult.
Seriously, though, I think there is some skill to be had with Lux. Any Lux that can land an ult without rooting me deserves my admiration.
Lux Yas and Darius at least take a little skill

You're actually right, her Q and now E from the radius nerf, are easy to dodge unless you flash or do it realllllyy up close.
Yasuo you need positioning, Darius you just need to do Darius things (idk i don't play him)
kindred is a noob champ tho .  dash, anti death, ranged, no skillshots, and doesn't need to learn how to CS in lane. {{sticker:sg-ezreal}}
